newsitem.title: USA: Cadence Design agrees to FTC consent order.
newsitem.headline: Cadence Design agrees to FTC consent order.

text.p: Cadence Design Systems Inc said it agreed to the U.S. Federal Trade Commission's issuing a consent order to facilitate closing its merger deal with Cooper & Chyan Technology Inc.

Under terms of the order, Cadence said it agreed to expand its Connections third-party software integration program to enable independent software vendors to develop and market interfaces to Cadence's integrated circuit design tools.
Cadence said it also agreed to give the FTC prior notice of certain future acquisitions of integrated circuit routing tool developers and vendors.
Cadence agreed to acquire Cooper & Chyan, which makes software tools for use by electronics designers, in October.
At the beginning of January, Cadence said the FRC had requested additional information regarding the merger.
The FTC had 60 days to withdraw, modify or finalise its acceptance of Cadence's agreement with it, the company said.
During this time, the agreement would also be made available for public comment, it said,
Cadence said it expected to complete the merger by the close of business May 7.
"The FTC's order is completely consistent with the Cadence philosophy and the direction in which we are moving," Cadence President Joe Costello said.
Cadence's Connections Program offers third-party companies an ability to link their products with Cadence's tools and methodologies for electronic product design.

Under the proposed FTC consent order, companies developing commercial integrated circuit routing technology will have the right to participate in the Connections program on terms "no less favorable than the terms applicable to any other participants," Cadence said.
